alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 5:39PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 615 PM MST... At 539 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bapchule to 6 miles southwest of Olberg. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chandler, Casa Grande, Coolidge, Queen Creek, Blackwater, Chandler Heights, Magma, San Tan Valley, Seville, Olberg, San Tan Mountain Park, Sacaton and Santan. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 174 and 190. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 130 and 158. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek
